intro: Crepis dioritica, commonly known as the diorite hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and slender, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often on acidic substrates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Crepis dioritica is a perennial species that thrives in high-altitude environments, showcasing adaptations to cold and arid conditions.
